message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static List<String> getDataBetweenQuotes(String text) {
    List<String> result = new ArrayList<>();
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(text, "\"");
    
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        result.add(st.nextToken());
    }
    
    return result;
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    String input = "Here just one \"comillas\"But I also could have more \"mas\" values in \"comillas\" and that \"is\" the \"trick\"";
    List<String> dataBetweenQuotes = getDataBetweenQuotes(input);
    
    for (String data : dataBetweenQuotes) {
        System.out.println(data);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code above uses the StringTokenizer to split the input text using the double quote character ("") as the delimiter. It then adds each token (the data between the quotes) to a list. Finally, it prints out each token in the list.
